New in and children's reading ideas

Reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11. We have recommendations for readers aged 11+ in our Young Adult section.

Snow in the Garden: a first book of Christmas, by Shirley Hughes

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 4, 2018

Today's book is Snow in the Garden: a first book of Christmas, by Shirley Hughes.

The Snowman, by Michael Morpurgo & Robin Shaw

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 3, 2018

Today's book is The Snowman, by Michael Morpurgo, Robin Shaw & Raymond Briggs.

Meg's Christmas, by David Walder & Jan Piénkowski

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 2, 2018

Today's book is Meg's Christmas, by David Walder & Jan Piénkowski.

Snowball, by Sue Hendra & Paul Linnet

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 1, 2018

Today's book is Snowball, by Sue Hendra & Paul Linnet.

Borrow an exceptional book from the Costa Children's Book Award shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Nov 23, 2018

The shortlist for the 2018 Costa Children's Book Award has been announced. Why not reserve one of these highly-recommended books?

Mark National Non-fiction November with the School Library Association Information Book Award shortlists

Written by Sophie Green · Published Nov 5, 2018

The winner of the School Library Association Information Book Award will be announced this week, as part of National Non-fiction November. We invite 7-16 year-olds to pick up an interesting book from one of the shortlists.

New children's books for November 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 30, 2018

This month's list features lots of snow and ice-themed books for winter.

Find your new favourite fiction or non-fiction book with the Blue Peter Book Awards longlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 25, 2018

The longlist for the 2019 Blue Peter Book Awards has been announced. Reserve a nominee today and see what you think.

Celebrate Halloween with these thrilling books for children

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 22, 2018

Close the curtains, light the pumpkins, snuggle up and enjoy a satisfyingly scary tale or two.

Encourage your children's wellbeing this Libraries Week with some of our favourite uplifting books

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 8, 2018

Libraries Week runs from 8 - 13 October 2018. As this year's theme is wellbeing, we've put together a list of children's books that we find especially uplifting and fulfilling.
